Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[tests] Fix Build error when running 'RunNUnitDeviceTests'" (#3055) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
When running `RunNUnitDeviceTests` manually you get
and error such as

	error MSB4036: The "SetEnvironmentVariable" task was not found.

This is because we are missing the `UsingTask` to bring
in this custom task. This is an issue only when running
`RunNUnitDeviceTests` manually. It does not happen when
running as part of `make run-apk-tests`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[build] Remove `llvm` submodule" (#3043) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We should prefer using mono's `llvm` submodule instead of providing
our own, as:

 1. Having *both* `external/llvm` *and* `external/mono/external/llvm`
    is confusing (which one "wins"?), and

 2. The one that *actually* matters ("wins") is mono's `llvm`, as
    that's the one included in the mono archive, which is now used by
    default (333b98b3).

Simplify life.  Remove `external/llvm`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to xamarin/xamarin-android-api-compatibility/master@670cc5e5" (#3052) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android/499/API_20Compatibility_20Checks

As mentioned in commit 679f95cd, there is some reported API breakage
which requires updating our reference API descriptions, e.g.
acceptable type removals such as
`System.Runtime.InteropServices._Type` and the removal of some
`virtual` method overrides in `System.IO.DirectoryInfo.Exists`.

Update external/xamarin-android-api-compatibility so that we don't
generate errors for these reviewed-and-accepted changes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "What is the point of the PinType enum?" (#6065) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
```
public enum PinType
{
	Generic,
	Place,
	SavedPin,
	SearchResult
}
```

This enum has been in Xamarin.Forms.Maps forever, but does absolutely nothing. It is not so much as referenced in any of the MapRenderer classes on any platform. I understand Xamarin's hesitance to remove public things, but if it has never been used for anything maybe it would be okay here. Are there any known third-party packages that extend Xamarin.Forms.Maps and use the PinType enum for something?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] ListView does not show Group labels when list is loaded in async method" (#6064) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

When the items of a ListView with enabled grouping are inserted in an async method, the group labels to not show up at all when clicking on a group name.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download attached solution (this is a demo solution  used for 2 bugs)
2. Start ToolbarDemo.UWP project
3. Click on Group label "1"

### Expected Behavior
Group tiles "1" and "2" are shown

### Actual Behavior
The ListView is totally empty.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.6.0.344457
- Last known good version: no
- IDE: VS 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - UWP:  17134 
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms
- Affected Devices: All

### Additional Information

If you just remove the line "await Task.Delay(2000);" you will see, that group labels are displayed correctly then!

### Reproduction Link
See 
[Solution.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3136139/Solution.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Enhancement] Visual Material - Nice if Visual property could be set from ControlTemplate" (#6063) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Summary
`Visual="Material"` has to be set in the XAML of each page or view.  That's very repetitive and a lot of scrubbing when making changes. Not to mention flies in the face of using `ControlTemplate`s to define all the common look & feel aspects of a page for example.

## API Changes

It would be nice if we could set the `VIsual` property in a `ControlTemplate` so all pages/views using that template automatically inherit the use of `Material` instead of having to scrub through countless existing views or having to add one more "don't forget" to the todo list when making more views/pages.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[d16-2] [apidiff] Keep the same guid when updating markdown documents" (#5977) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
We often (e.g. previews, service releases) update the API diff during
a release cycle. The current code generated a new GUID every time, which
is not what correct since it's the same document.

This uses an MD5 digest of the filename as the source of the GUID so
it will remain constant once created (and updated).

Backport of #5976.

/cc @spouliot
